page.title: 03RELIGION
page.content: The most important church in the area is the parish church at Kirkhill,which has a long history.However,the present church was built in 1840.Shields which decorate the roof of the church are a reminder of the notable families of the past.The names of their residences are used today on local maps,for example Newton,Rosebank and Gilbertfield.Since the turn of the century there has been a considerable increase in the Roman Catholic population,largely a result of immigration from Ireland.The Church serving the congregation is St Cadoc's in Halfway.
